summary: Carnivora is an order of mammals that eat mostly meat. There are over 279 species found all over the world, from the poles to deserts. They come in many shapes and sizes. Carnivorans are split into two groups: Feliformia (cat-like) and Caniformia (dog-like). Feliforms include cats, hyenas, and mongooses, mostly from the Old World. Caniforms include dogs, bears, skunks, and seals, found worldwide with diverse traits.
title: Carnivora
